src:
Sempat Viral, Pergerakan Tanah Lokasi Tambang di Kaltara Bukan Likuifaksi
05 Nov 2019, 06:19 by iman


Sempat Viral, Pergerakan Tanah Lokasi Tambang di Kaltara Bukan Likuifaksi

KBRN, Jakarta-Kasus dari pergerakan tanah yang terjadi di wilayah lahan usaha milik PT Pipit Mutiara Jaya (IUP PMDN) site Bebatu, Kabupaten Tana Tidung, Kalimantan Utara, Sabtu (2/11/2019) sempat viral di media sosial.
Terkait kasus itu, tim  Badan Penanggulangan Bencana Daerah (BPBD) Provinsi Kalimantan Utara (Kaltara) bersama tim dari PT. Pipit Mutiara Jaya melakukan peninjauan lapangan atas peristiwa patahan di lokasi tersebut. 
"Kegiatan peninjauan lapangan tersebut dilakukan sebagai tindak lanjut dari laporan tentang peristiwa longsoran tanah yang sempat diduga merupakan fenomena likuifaksi pada tanggal 29 Oktober 2019 lalu."kata Kepala Pusat Data Informasi dan Humas Badan Nasional Penanggulangan Bencana (BNPB) Agus Wibowo dalam keterangan tertulisnya, Selasa (5/11/2019). 
Setelah dilakukan peninjauan lapangan, menurut Agus  diperoleh data korban jiwa dinyatakan nihil/tidak ada, namun ada 6 unit alat berat yang tertimbun di antaranya; 3 excavator, 1 Dozer, 1 ADT, 1 LV. "Menurut data yang diterima, 3 excavator sudah berhasil dievakuasi,"ujarnya.
Berdasarkan hasil peninjauan tersebut ditambah hasil investigasi oleh tim dari Dinas ESDM Provinsi Kaltara, Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Provinsi Kaltara dan Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Kabupaten Tana Tidung disimpulkan bahwa fenomena itu bukan merupakan likuifaksi atau pencairan tanah seperti yang sempat beredar luas.
Kedepannya, menurut Agus pihak dinas terkait diharapkan agar dapat meningkatkan kewaspadaan dan pengawasan Kuasa Penguasaan (KP) di wilayah kerja masing-masing. Sedangkan bagi masyarakat dan para pekerja agar tidak terpengaruh isu yang tidak dapat dipertanggung jawabkan.
text:
Had Viral, Land Movement Location of Mining in Kaltara Not Liquidation
05 Nov 2019, 06:19 by faith


Had Viral, Land Movement Location of Mining in Kaltara Not Liquidation

KBRN, Jakarta - The case of land movement that occurred in the business area of PT Pipit Mutiara Jaya (IUP PMDN) site Bebatu, Tana Tidung Regency, North Kalimantan, Saturday (11/02/2019) had a viral chance on social media.
Related to the case, the team of the Regional Disaster Management Agency (BPBD) of North Kalimantan Province (Kaltara) together with a team from PT. Pipit Mutiara Jaya conducted a field survey of the fault at the location.
"The field survey was carried out as a follow-up to a report on the landslide event that was suspected to be a liquefaction phenomenon on October 29, 2019," said Head of the Information and Public Relations Center for Disaster Management National Agency (BNPB) Agus Wibowo in his written statement on Tuesday. (11/5/2019).
After conducting a field survey, according to Agus, data obtained of fatalities was declared zero / none, but there were 6 units of heavy equipment buried including; 3 excavators, 1 Dozer, 1 ADT, 1 LV. "According to the data received, 3 excavators have been successfully evacuated," he said.
Based on the results of the review plus the results of an investigation by a team from the East Kalimantan Province ESDM Office, the East Kalimantan Provincial Environment Agency and the Tana Tidung Regency Environmental Agency, it was concluded that the phenomenon was not a liquidity or liquefaction of the land as it had been widely circulated.
In the future, according to Agus, the related agencies are expected to be able to increase the awareness and supervision of the Power of Attorney (KP) in their respective work areas. As for the community and workers so as not to be affected by issues that cannot be accounted for.
